components.templateData:
<mat-chip-list *ngIf="content" [ngClass]="classes">
  <mat-chip color="{{item?.color || 'primary'}}" selected="{{item?.selected}}" *ngFor="let item of content.elements">
    <ng-container *ngIf="!item.href;else link">
      {{item.label}}
    </ng-container>
    <ng-template #link>
      <app-link [content]="item"></app-link>
    </ng-template>
  </mat-chip>
</mat-chip-list>

components.name: ContactUsComponent
ContentBoxComponent

DatepickerComponent
components.templateData:
<!-- range -->
<ng-container *ngIf="content?.range">
  <mat-form-field class="width-100" [appearance]="content.appearance || 'fill'" *ngIf="content" [formGroup]="form">
    <mat-label *ngIf="content.label">{{content.label}}</mat-label>
    <mat-date-range-input [rangePicker]="pickerRange">
      <input matStartDate formControlName="start" [placeholder]="content?.placeholder?.start || ''">
      <input matEndDate formControlName="end" [placeholder]="content?.placeholder?.end || ''">
    </mat-date-range-input>
    <mat-datepicker-toggle matSuffix [for]="pickerRange"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    <mat-date-range-picker [dateClass]="content?.classes" [opened]="content?.opened" #pickerRange>
    </mat-date-range-picker>
  </mat-form-field>
</ng-container>

<!-- key -->
<ng-container *ngIf="!content?.range && content?.key && !content.inline">
  <mat-form-field class="width-100" [appearance]="content.appearance || 'fill'" *ngIf="content" [formGroup]="form">
    <mat-label *ngIf="content.label">{{content.label}}</mat-label>
    <input matInput formControlName="{{content.key}}" [matDatepicker]="datepicker"
      [placeholder]="content?.placeholder || ''">
    <mat-datepicker-toggle matSuffix [for]="datepicker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    <mat-datepicker [dateClass]="content?.classes" #datepicker></mat-datepicker>
    <mat-hint *ngIf="content.hint">{{content.hint}}</mat-hint>
    <mat-error *ngIf="!isValid">{{content.errorMes}}</mat-error>
  </mat-form-field>
</ng-container>

<!-- inline -->
<ng-container *ngIf="content?.inline">
  <mat-card class="inline-calendar-card">
    <mat-calendar (selectedChange)="onSelectedChange($event)" [(selected)]="content.value"></mat-calendar>
  </mat-card>
</ng-container>

components.name: DialogComponent
components.templateData: {{data.title}}

components.name: DownloadComponent
DropdownMenuComponent
components.templateData:
<ng-container *ngIf="content">
  <mat-accordion multi>
    <ng-container *ngFor="let item of content">
      <mat-list *ngIf="!item.child">
        <mat-list-item>
          <app-link [content]="item"></app-link>
        </mat-list-item>
      </mat-list>
      <mat-expansion-panel *ngIf="item.child" (opened)="panelOpenState = true" (closed)="panelOpenState = false">
        <mat-expansion-panel-header>
          <mat-panel-title *ngIf="!item.href" [ngClass]="item.classes">
            {{item.label}}
          </mat-panel-title>
          <app-link *ngIf="item.href" [ngClass]="item.classes" [content]="item"></app-link>
        </mat-expansion-panel-header>
        <app-dropdown-menu [content]="item.child"></app-dropdown-menu>
      </mat-expansion-panel>
    </ng-container>
  </mat-accordion>
</ng-container>

components.template:
Acme

Welcome, {{ user.name }}!
components.sourceCode:
import { Component, Input, Output, EventEmitter } from '@angular/core'; import { User } from './User'; @Component({ selector: 'storybook-header', template: `

Acme

Welcome, {{ user.name }}!
`, styleUrls: ['./header.css'], }) export default class HeaderComponent { @Input() user: User | null = null; @Output() onLogin = new EventEmitter(); @Output() onLogout = new EventEmitter(); @Output() onCreateAccount = new EventEmitter(); }

components.name: PageComponent
components.template:
Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
components.sourceCode:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { User } from './User'; @Component({ selector: 'storybook-page', template: `

Pages in Storybook

We recommend building UIs with a component-driven process starting with atomic components and ending with pages.

Render pages with mock data. This makes it easy to build and review page states without needing to navigate to them in your app. Here are some handy patterns for managing page data in Storybook:

  • Use a higher-level connected component. Storybook helps you compose such data from the "args" of child component stories
  • Assemble data in the page component from your services. You can mock these services out using Storybook.

Get a guided tutorial on component-driven development at Storybook tutorials . Read more in the docs .

Tip Adjust the width of the canvas with the Viewports addon in the toolbar
`, styleUrls: ['./page.css'], }) export default class PageComponent { user: User | null = null; doLogout() { this.user = null; } doLogin() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } doCreateAccount() { this.user = { name: 'Jane Doe' }; } }

propertiesClass.name: filteredOptions
propertiesClass.description: list of banks filtered by search keyword
propertiesClass.rawdescription: list of banks filtered by search keyword

propertiesClass.name: searchCtrl
propertiesClass.description: control for the MatSelect filter keyword multi-selection
propertiesClass.rawdescription: control for the MatSelect filter keyword multi-selection

methodsClass.name: setInitialValue
methodsClass.rawdescription: Sets the initial value after the filteredBanks are loaded initially
methodsClass.description: Sets the initial value after the filteredBanks are loaded initially

components.templateData:
<mat-form-field [appearance]="content.appearance || 'legacy'" class="width-100" [formGroup]="form" *ngIf="form">
  <mat-label>{{content.label}}</mat-label>

  <!--  -->
  <mat-select disableOptionCentering="true" panelClass="custom-select" *ngIf="!content.multiple && !content.search"
    [formControlName]="content.key" disableRipple #select>
    <mat-option *ngIf="content?.none">{{content.none?.label || ''}}</mat-option>
    <mat-option value="{{option.value}}" *ngFor="let option of options">{{option.label}}
    </mat-option>
  </mat-select>

  <!--  -->
  <mat-select disableOptionCentering="true" panelClass="custom-select" *ngIf="!content.multiple && content.search"
    [formControlName]="content.key" disableRipple #select>
    <mat-option>
      <ngx-mat-select-search [placeholderLabel]="content.placeholder || ''"
        [noEntriesFoundLabel]="content.noFound || ''" [formControl]="searchCtrl"></ngx-mat-select-search>
    </mat-option>
    <mat-option *ngIf="content?.none">{{content.none?.label || ''}}</mat-option>
    <mat-option *ngFor="let option of filteredOptions | async" [value]="option.value">{{option.label}}
    </mat-option>
  </mat-select>

  <!--  -->
  <mat-select disableOptionCentering="true" panelClass="custom-select" *ngIf="content.multiple && !content.search"
    [formControlName]="content.key" multiple disableRipple #select>
    <mat-option *ngIf="content?.none">{{content.none?.label || ''}}</mat-option>
    <mat-option value="{{option.value}}" *ngFor="let option of options">{{option.label}}
    </mat-option>
  </mat-select>

  <!--  -->
  <mat-select disableOptionCentering="true" panelClass="custom-select" *ngIf="content.multiple && content.search"
    [formControlName]="content.key" multiple disableRipple #select>
    <mat-option>
      <ngx-mat-select-search [placeholderLabel]="content.placeholder || ''"
        [noEntriesFoundLabel]="content.noFound || ''" [formControl]="searchCtrl"></ngx-mat-select-search>
    </mat-option>
    <mat-option *ngIf="content?.none">{{content.none?.label || ''}}</mat-option>
    <mat-option *ngFor="let option of filteredOptions | async" [value]="option.value">{{option.label}}
    </mat-option>
  </mat-select>
  <mat-error *ngIf="isValid">{{content.errorMes}}</mat-error>
</mat-form-field>

components.name: TextareaComponent
components.templateData:
<mat-form-field class="width-100" [formGroup]="form" *ngIf="content" [appearance]="content.appearance || 'fill'">
  <mat-label>{{content.label}}</mat-label>
  <textarea [mat-autosize]="true" [matAutosizeMinRows]="content.params?.matAutosizeMinRows" matInput
    formControlName="{{content.key}}" placeholder="{{content.placeholder}}" [id]="content.key"
    [rows]="content.rows||1"></textarea>
  <mat-error *ngIf="isValid">{{content.errorMes}}</mat-error>
</mat-form-field>
